intro: Cyphostemma kaniamae subsp. kaniamae, commonly known as the Kaniama karo plant, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its succulent stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically followed by elongated, green fruits. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
